ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about so many different fields of cog sci and got inspiration for my thesis.
great overview of lots of areas of cognitive science, and the last lecture gave a great understanding of what would happen in the course.

This course introduced a wide range of research topics in Cognitive Science via guest lectures and discussions, which helped me develop a research idea for my senior project. I also got a feel for the timeline and structure of the senior project for the Cognitive Science major.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great diversity of courses, but I maybe would've liked for the last lecture about the senior thesis to happen more at the beginning. but maybe it wouldn't matter either way. idk
Great way to meet cognitive science faculty and learn about ongoing research.
More interaction than just reading papers

Strengths: Lectures were diverse in topic, and guest speakers did a nice job of tailoring their presentations to an audience of undergraduate students and engaging with students throughout their lectures (pausing for questions/opening things up for discussion periodically). 

Weaknesses: The course assignments were mainly summaries of papers for each guest lecture. Reading the papers was a good way to get a feel for the speakers work prior to class, but I think it might have been helpful to have a few guiding questions for the assignments to better direct my focus to lecture content. I also do think the course is quite long (especially for a half-credit course  it is the length of a typical one-credit, once-a-week seminar). I feel that I could have effectively engaged with the content of lectures in an hour or hour and a half period.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! also you literally have to take it for the major haha

If you are in the Cognitive Science major, you are required to take this course. That aside, I think the content is really interesting and its a great help in getting started with research in terms of finding an area that interests you and connecting with professors in that field. Just something to keep in mind when you are choosing your schedule: this semester, there was a Friday and a Monday section of the course  the Monday section was a lot larger than Friday. I was in the Friday section, and found that the smaller class size facilitated meaningful discussions (compared to what I heard from those in the Monday section). I dont think the section you choose will make or break the experience, but thought this information might be helpful to some.
